definition: Appellate Authority for Advance Ruling - Reviews advance rulings issued by GAAR under GST Act Sections 98-101
technicalNote: Hears appeals against GAAR orders under Section 108 of GST Act. Established at state level to resolve disputes on advance rulings.

definition: GST Authority for Advance Ruling - Issues advance rulings on GST matters to provide clarity before transactions
technicalNote: Constituted under Section 96 of GST Act. Provides rulings on classification, applicability of notifications, and tax liability.

definition: GST Appellate Tribunal - Second appellate authority hearing appeals against Commissioner (Appeals) orders
technicalNote: Constituted under Section 109 CGST Act. State Benches handle regional matters, Principal Bench in Delhi handles larger questions of law.

definition: Customs, Excise and Service Tax Appellate Tribunal - Quasi-judicial body handling indirect tax disputes (pre-GST and continuing)
technicalNote: Established under Section 129 of Customs Act, 1962. Handles appeals for Customs, erstwhile Central Excise, and Service Tax matters. Regional benches across India.

definition: Original authority (Proper Officer or Commissionerate) that issues the first order in GST disputes
technicalNote: Powers derived from Section 73-74 of GST Act. Issues Show Cause Notices (SCN) and adjudication orders determining tax liability.

definition: Commissioner (Appeals) or Appellate Authority - First level of review against original adjudication orders
technicalNote: Hears appeals under Section 107 of GST Act. Must be filed within 3 months of the order date. State-level appellate authority.

definition: Commissioner (Appeals) - Officer designated to hear first appeals against adjudication orders
technicalNote: Appointed under GST Act to provide first tier of appellate review. Jurisdiction based on territorial assignment.

definition: Authority under Section 108 GST Act empowered to revise orders prejudicial to revenue
technicalNote: Commissioner or specified officer can revise orders passed by subordinate authorities within specified time limits. Suo moto power.

definition: Head bench of an appellate tribunal, typically located at the national capital
technicalNote: Principal Bench of CESTAT/GSTAT in New Delhi handles matters of national importance and larger benches. Precedential value higher than regional benches.

definition: Show Cause Notice - Formal document issued by tax authorities requiring the taxpayer to explain why duty/tax should not be demanded
technicalNote: Issued under GST Act before adjudication. Taxpayer must reply within specified timeframe (typically 30 days, extendable).

definition: Officer empowered under GST law to perform specific functions like assessment, adjudication, or recovery
technicalNote: Defined under GST Act. Powers assigned based on monetary limits and territorial jurisdiction.

definition: Electronic submission of legal documents, petitions, and pleadings through online portals
technicalNote: GST authorities use ACES (Automation of Central Excise and Service Tax), CBIC Portal, or state-specific e-filing systems.

definition: Automation of Central Excise and Service Tax - Online portal for e-filing appeals and applications with CESTAT
technicalNote: Mandatory for most CESTAT filings. Provides case status tracking, online payment, and document submission.

definition: Geographical or subject-matter area over which a legal authority has power to adjudicate
technicalNote: In GST, jurisdiction determined by registered office location (CGST/SGST) or transaction origin. Tribunal jurisdiction by bench location.

definition: Physical location where a tribunal bench or appellate authority operates
technicalNote: CESTAT has benches in major cities (Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Kolkata, Ahmedabad, Bangalore, etc.). Cases assigned based on jurisdiction.

definition: Hierarchical tier in the GST adjudication and appellate system
technicalNote: Ranges from Adjudication (original orders) through First Appeal, Tribunal, to High Court and Supreme Court. Each level has specific jurisdiction and powers.

definition: Quasi-judicial body with specialized expertise in specific areas of law like taxation, customs, or service tax
technicalNote: CESTAT and GSTAT are key tribunals for indirect tax matters. Decisions can be appealed to High Court on questions of law.

definition: Constitutional court at state level with original and appellate jurisdiction
technicalNote: Hears appeals from tribunals and lower courts. Issues writ petitions for constitutional matters. Decisions binding within state.

definition: Apex court of India with final appellate jurisdiction on all matters
technicalNote: Hears appeals from High Courts on substantial questions of law. Decisions are binding across India as precedent.
